Quick search

Enter search terms or a module, class or function name.

data¶

roipy.data Module¶

Interferogram and Set classes for working with ROI_PAC output: attributes in UpperCase methods in lower_case

class roipy.data.Geogram(filepath)¶

Bases: roipy.data.Interferogram

Class for georectified files, for now only difference Georeferenced=True

class roipy.data.Interferogram(filepath)¶

General interferogram object (from any platform: ERS, Envisat, ALOS) Designed for BIL/RMG files output by ROI_PAC that have associated rsc’s

>>> import roi_py as rp
>>> ig = rp.data.Interferogram(path/to/interferogram)
>>> print ig
add2rsc()¶

Add custom header lines to rsc metadata stored in memory

associate_files()¶

Add dictionary of associate ROI_PAC files to the Interferogram object

fix_timespan()¶

Write the missing ‘TIME_SPAN_YEAR’ keyword to the .rsc file, get the timespan from extracting the second date from the DATE12 keyword

get_dates()¶

Extract dates from the metadata and convert them to serial dates

load_bil(dims=None)¶

Load amplitude and phase array from BIL files (eg .unw) output by ROI_PAC

self = roi_py.data.Interferogram instance dims = (width,length) tuple to override .rsc dimensions geo = True if .unw is georeferenced to maintain correct array orientation

(leftArray, rightArray) = 2D numpy arrays

look,head = incidence file amplitude,phase = .unw file slope,elevation = .hgt file

load_rsc()¶

Read from unw.rsc file & store metadata as an attribute dictionary named rsc

setup()¶
class roipy.data.Set(directory, prefix='rect')¶

Class for representing a set of rectified interferograms.

>>> track227 = Set(<path/to/rectified/227/interferograms>) 
>>> print track227
assign_baselines()¶

Use self.Baselines dictionary to assign perp baseline as ig attribute

get_chronlist()¶

Get a chronologically sorted list of IG files

get_dates()¶

Assign lists of metadata values as instance attributes

get_interferograms()¶

Assign list of date pairs as Set() attributes in both YYMMDD format and serial format

get_time_index()¶

Generate the time_index assigning an integer to each SAR acquistion in chronological order. Used to construct B matrix for SBAS inversion

get_time_intervals()¶

Subtract serial dates to get day intervals

load_baselines(path='list.out')¶

Read perpendicular baselines from list.out from dolist.m output, store as a dictionary {‘date’: Bperp}

load_set(prefix='rect_')¶

Create a dictionary of Interferogram.General() instances from all rect*unw files in the specificed path

igrams = Interferogram.load_set(os.getcwd())

match_date(date)¶

Return a list of dates that pair with a given date

match_igrams(Set, date)¶

Return an array of all interferograms containing a certain date (integer)

merge_tandems()¶

Combine SAR acquisitions that differ by only 1 day into a single date ASSUMPTION: one day’s deformation is NOT resolvable

next()¶

Iterate through interferograms in chronological order

omit(date=False, IG=False, range=False)¶

Omit a particular interferogram or all interferograms containing a particular date from the time series.

IMPORTANT! Run this method before running prep_matlab()

date = single date in quotes, eg ‘20010812’ IG = list of interferogram data identifiers, eg [‘20010812-20100723’] range = tuple of start & end dates, scrap all interferograms outside of range

query(attr=None, val=None, outattr=None, IG=None)¶

Search metadata for all interferograms and return a list of results

>>>query(IG=#) return metadata for the specified IG# >>>query(<metadata field>) return value of specified metadata field for all IGs >>>query(<metadata field>, <value>) return list of IGs sharing common metadata attribute >>>query(‘PLATFORM’,’ERS1’) return list of ERS1 interferograms >>>query(‘PLATFORM’,’ERS2’,’DATE12’) return list of ordered DATE12 values for ERS2 IGs >>>query(IG=23) return metadata for interferogram #23 in the timeseries

remit(date=False, IG=False)¶

Put an omitted date back into the timeseries

setup()¶

Associate important timeseries arrays with the interferogram ORDER MATTERS... eg self.Nig reset before get_interferograms()
